pitchLab.pianoWindow
Class PianoWindow

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Window
              java.awt.Frame
                  javax.swing.JFrame
                      pitchLab.pianoWindow.PianoWindow
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.WindowListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class PianoWindow
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements java.awt.event.WindowListener

Generates the Piano Window used during PitchLab tests

Version:
0.6 April 7, 2009 TODO: Fix file writing... not outputting the correct "user selected" in active mode TODO: Passive relative training has issue with timer.. its off.. not producing milliseconds
Author:
Gavin Shriver

Constructor Detail

PianoWindow

public PianoWindow(int mode,
                   int cycles)
Initializes the piano window with appropriate settings based on the mode PitchLab is currently in

Parameters:
mode - The mode PitchLab is currently in
cycles - The number of test cycles that will be performed
Method Detail

isMouseWithinDragBarMargin

public static boolean isMouseWithinDragBarMargin(int mouseX)
Gives a margin on the bar that the user drags across the piano so the user doesn't have to click the exact pixel but instead has a bit of leeway.

Parameters:
mouseX - The x-coordinate of the the mouse with respect to the Piano Window

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Open the Piano Window and set its visibility to true

lazyLoadInstrument

public void lazyLoadInstrument(boolean random)
Deprecated. 

Lazyloads an instrument based on a String which is taken from the 'Drop Down' menu in the main PitchLab window. This was used when developing a method to load different instruments based on the Main Window drop-down selection.

Parameters:
random - Determines whether to load a random series of notes or just a single note of the instrument.

windowClosing

public void windowClosing(java.awt.event.WindowEvent e)
Set the Piano Window close event

Specified by:
windowClosing in interface java.awt.event.WindowListener
Parameters:
e - The event that triggers when the piano window closes

exiting

public void exiting()
Called when the Piano Window closes and prompts the user with an alert box asking to confirm exiting the test.

exit

public void exit()
Called after the user has confirmed Exiting the PitchLab test. Ends any sine wave thats playing, resets the count and if the user has selected to submit results, the test results are emailed.

timeStamp

public void timeStamp(long time)
Timestamp in milliseconds that is added to the time array used by all PitchLab modes.

Parameters:
time - The time in milliseconds

playRands

public void playRands()
Plays random sine waves, called at the beginning of each test cycle.

getCyclesString

public java.lang.String getCyclesString()
Returns a string that indicates the total number of test cycles completed so far. This string is shown at the top of the Piano Window and updated after each test.

paint

public void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
Draws the Piano Window and sets whether the draggable bar should be shown and where it should it placed.

Overrides:
paint in class java.awt.Window

setDragBarVisible

public void setDragBarVisible(boolean dragBarVisible)
Sets the visibility boolean of the draggable bar in the Piano Window

Parameters:
dragBarVisible - A boolean indicating whether or not to show the draggable bar

public boolean getDragBarVisible()
Returns the draggable bar visibility state
